newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Thomson BankWatch rates Romania's Bancorex bank.
newsitem.headline: Thomson BankWatch rates Romania's Bancorex bank.

text.p: Banking credit rating service Thomson BankWatch said on Wednesday it had assigned a BB-minus (BB-) long-term senior debt rating to Romania's large state-run bank Banca Romana de Comert Exterior Bancorex SA.
The service said it had also reaffirmed its LC-1 short-term local currency debt rating, implying a very high likelihood of interest and principle, for Bancorex.

"Our Long-Term Senior Debt and Short-Term Ratings reflect the bank's state ownership and the bank's important role in the Romanian economy," said a Thomson BankWatch statement made available to Reuters.
The BB-minus score is slightly below investment grade and in line with ratings allocated by specialised sovereign debt rating agencies for Romania last year.
Japan Credit Rating agency awarded Romania a BB-plus, somewhat higher than the BB- minus ratings of Standard and Poor's and IBCA and BA-three from Moody's Investors Service.
Last year, Thomson BankWatch allocated its first investment grade local currency ratings to 10 Romanian banks, seven of them receiving LC-1.
Bancorex, specialised in foreign trade financing, handles the bulk of foreign exchange trading on the local market.
It has a share capital of 93.2 billion lei, with the State Ownership Fund holding 63 percent and private ownership funds some 27 percent. The rest goes to corporations and individuals.

According to latest available data, its gross profit over January-June 1996 was 159.8 billion lei, with total assets of 8.3 trillion lei at end-June. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom, 40-1 3120264
